metadata.dc:author: Iñiguez-Rodríguez, María Del Rocío
Vázquez-Lamadrid, Jorge
Criales-Vera, Sergio Andrés
metadata.dc:description: Coccidioidomycosis is a systemic infection caused by the soil fungus Coccidioides immitis. It is endemic in northern Mexico and the southwest part of the United States. Radiologic manifestations are varied. Rupture of a coccidioidal pulmonary cavity with subsequent pneumothorax is a rare clinical event, even in endemic areas. We present a case with a brief review of this rare condition.
metadata.dc:title: Neumotórax espontáneo secundario a coccidioidomicosis pulmonar.
[Spontaneous pneumothorax due to pulmonary coccidioidomycosis].
